channel.title: CVE Feed for Fresenius Kabi -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fresenius Kabi -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-23207|2024-08-03T19:05:54.432Z -- fresenius%20kabi -- vigilant%20software%20suite%20%28mastermed%20dashboard%29
item.description: An attacker with physical access to the host can extract the secrets from the registry and create valid JWT tokens for the Fresenius Kabi Vigilant MasterMed version 2.0.1.3 application and impersonate arbitrary users. An attacker could manipulate RabbitMQ queues and messages by impersonating users.

item.title: CVE-2021-23195|2024-08-03T19:05:54.450Z -- fresenius%20kabi -- vigilant%20software%20suite%20%28mastermed%20dashboard%29
item.description: Fresenius Kabi Vigilant Software Suite (Mastermed Dashboard) version 2.0.1.3 has the option for automated indexing (directory listing) activated. When accessing a directory, a web server delivers its entire content in HTML form. If an index file does not exist and directory listing is enabled, all content of the directory will be displayed, allowing an attacker to identify and access files on the server.

item.title: CVE-2021-23233|2024-08-03T19:05:53.889Z -- fresenius%20kabi -- agilia%20link%2B
item.description: Sensitive endpoints in Fresenius Kabi Agilia Link+ v3.0 and prior can be accessed without any authentication information such as the session cookie. An attacker can send requests to sensitive endpoints as an unauthenticated user to perform critical actions or modify critical configuration parameters.

item.title: CVE-2021-23236|2024-08-03T19:05:55.456Z -- fresenius%20kabi -- agilia%20link%2B
item.description: Requests may be used to interrupt the normal operation of the device. When exploited, Fresenius Kabi Agilia Link+ version 3.0 must be rebooted via a hard reset triggered by pressing a button on the rack system.

item.title: CVE-2021-23196|2024-08-03T19:05:55.666Z -- fresenius%20kabi -- agilia%20link%2B
item.description: The web application on Agilia Link+ version 3.0 implements authentication and session management mechanisms exclusively on the client-side and does not protect authentication attributes sufficiently.
